text: Chlorophyll obtained from green leaves of plant can be shown to be composed of more than one coloured component by the technique of
explanation:
The chlorophyll from the green leaves of plant being a mixture can be separated by Chromatography into its different components. Chromatography has to do with the separation of coloured components. chromatography  is used in industrial processes to purify materials, test trace amounts of contaminants, isolate chiral compounds, and quality control test products
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In countries where the temperature falls below 273K, salt is always sprinkled on the icy road in order to

options.A: lower the melting point of the ice
options.B: increase the density of the ice
options.D: raise the melting point of the ice

explanation:
The presence of impurities in a substance lowers the melting point. Salt is added on icy roads to cause the ice to melt on time.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
2Na(s) + 2H2O(l) → 2NaOH(aq) + H2(g)
From the equation above, calculate the mass of sodium hydroxide produced by 2.3g of sodium.
[H = 1, O = 16, Na = 23]
explanation:
2Na(s) + 2H2O(l) → 2NaOH(aq) + H2(g)Relative molecular mass of NaOH = 23 + 16 + 1 = 40smol-12 * 23g of sodium react with water to produce2 * 40g of NaOH∴ 2.3g of sodium will react with water to produce(2.3 * 40 * 2)/(23 * 2) = 4.00g
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
16.8 g of sodium hydrogen trioxocarbonate (IV) is completely decomposed by heat. Calculate the volume of carbon(IV) oxide given off at s.t.p
[Na 23, C = 12, O = 16, H = 1, Molar volume of a gas at s.t.p = 22.4 dm3]
explanation:
2NaHCO3(s) → Na2CO3(s) + H2O(l) + CO2Relative molecular mass of NaHCO3 = 23 +1 + 12 + 16 * 3 = 84gmol-12 * 84g of NaHCO3 will be liberated 22.4dm3 or CO2 at s.t.p16.8g of NaHCO3 will liberate (16.8 * 22.4)/(2 * 84) = 2.24 dm3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: 300 cm3 of gas has a pressure of 800 mmHg. If the pressure is reduced to 650 mmHg, find its volume
explanation:
P1V1= P2V2800 * 300 = 650 * V2V2 = (800 * 300)/650 = 369.23 cm3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Diffusion is slowest in solid particles than in particles of liquid and gases because

options.A: solid particles have more kinetic energy than the particles of liquid and gases
options.B: solid particles have less kinetic energy than the particles of liqiud and gases
options.C: solid particles have less restriction in their movement than liquid and gas particles
options.D: the particles in solids are far apart and the cohesive forces between them are negligible

explanation:
Diffusion is faster in gases owing to their higher kinetic energy i.e increase in kinetic energy of molecules leads to increase in rate of diffusion.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The experiment that showed that atoms have tiny positively charged nucleus was first carried out by
explanation:
The experiment that showed that atoms have tiny positively charged nuclei was first carried out by Rutherford.Rutherford's gold foil experimentshowed that the atom is mostly empty space with a tiny, dense, positively charged nucleus.

text: The atom of an element X is represented as \(_z^yX\). The basic chemical properties of X depends on the value of
explanation:

explanation:

text: In the periodic table, the electrical and thermal conductivities are properties of elements that

options.A: decrease across the period and increase down the group
options.B: increase across the period and decrease down the group
options.C: decrease across the period and down the group`
options.D: increase acrosss the period and down the group

explanation:
In the periodic table, electrical and thermal conductivities of elements decrease across the period and increase down the group.

text:
\( _{11} ^{23}Na + _0^1n → _{11}^{24}Na \)
The reaction above is an example of
explanation:
Artificial transmutation. It is an artificially induced nuclear reaction caused by the bombardment of a nucleus with subatomic particles or small nuclei. It is also called artififcial radioactivity.

explanation:

text: In the course of purifying water for town supply the water is passed through large settlings tanks, containing sodium aluminate (III) to remove?
explanation:
Potash alum [kAl(S\({O}_4\))\(_2\)] n sodium aluminate (ii) (NaHCO\(_2\)) are added to cause coagulation.
As  fine particles to clump together, forming large particles heavy enough to settle at the bottom of the tanks as impurities.

text: When a few drops of water is added to a blue anhydrous cobalt (II) chloride, the colour changes to
explanation:

explanation:

text:
117.0g of sodium chloride was dissolved in 1.0dm3 of distilled water at 25°C. Determine the solubility in mol dm-3 of sodium chloride at that temperature
[Na = 23, Cl = 35.5]
explanation:
Relative molecular mass of NaCl = 23 + 35.5 = 58.5 g/molNo. of mole of NaCl = 117/58.5 = 2.0 mol

explanation:

The basicity of CH3COOH is

text: 0.05 mol dm-3 HCl is neutralized by 25 cm3 NaOH. If the volume of acid used is 32.00cm3, what is the concentration of the base
explanation:
HCl + NaOH → NaCl + H2OCAVA = NA/NB = (0.05 * 32)/(CB * 25)∴ CB = (0.05 * 32)/25 = 0.064 mol dm-3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Insoluble salts can be prepared by?

options.A: titrating an alkali against an appropriate acid
options.B: reacting an acid with trioxocarbonate (IV) salt
options.C: directing combination of the elements which make up the salt
options.D: mixing two soluble compounds containing the metallic radical and the acidic radical

explanation:
An insoluble salt can be preparedby a precipitation method through a double decomposition reaction.
Two soluble metal salts react with each other to form one soluble salt and one insoluble salt .
Lead nitrate solution and sodium chloride solution react to produce solid lead chloride , leaving soluble sodium nitrate in solution.
The lead chloride can be recovered by filtration.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The oxidation state of carbon in HCOOH is
explanation:
HCOOHO.N of H + O.N of C + 2* O.N of oxygen ofH = 01 + X + 2X - 2 + 1 = 02 + X -4 = 0X = 4 - 2 = +2

text:
If a given quantity of electricity liberates 0.65g of Zn2+, what amount of Hg2+ would be liberated by the same quantity of current?
[Zn = 65, Hg = 201]
explanation:
At the cathode, we have:\(Zn^{2+} + 2e^- → Zn_{(s)}\)Normally, we need2F → 65gx → 0.65x = 0.02FLet us check how much mercury will be deposited by 0.02F of electricity\(Hg^{2+} + 2e^-(aq) → Hg_{(s)}\)2F → 201g∴ 0.02F = xx = 2.01g

text:
\(NH_{3(g)} + HCl_{(g)} → NH_4Cl_{(s)}\)
The entropy change in the system above is
explanation:
\(NH_{3(g)} + HCl_{(g)} → NH_4Cl_{(s)}\)Reactant = 2 moles of gaseous moleculesProduct = 1 mole of gaseous moleculeEntropy change = 1 - 2 = -1 (negative)

text: Which of the following reaction is endothermic?
explanation:
Water Gas is a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen produced from synthesis gas.\(H_2O + C --> H_2 + CO\) (H=+131KJ/mol)An Endothermic process is any process which requires or absorbs thermal energy from its surroundings, usually in the form of heat.in Endothermic reaction ∆H is positive.Therefore it is Endothermic

text: A catalyst speeds up the rate of chemical reaction by

options.B: increasing the activation energy of the reaction
options.C: lowering the activation energy of the reaction

explanation:
Catalyst lowers the activation energy of reaction and hence speeds up the rate of chemical reaction.

text: The rate of a reaction usually decreases with a decrease in the concentration of reactants because
explanation:
Decrease in the concentration of reactants reduces the number of molecules that acquire effective collisions, and consequently reduces the reaction rate.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The substance that is used in the steel industry for the removal of carbon, sulphur and phosphorus impurities from pig iron is
explanation:
The substance used in the steel industry for the removal of carbon, sulphur, and phosphorus impurities from pig iron isoxygen. This process is called "oxidation" and it occurs when oxygen reacts with the impurities in the pig iron, which then form oxides that can be easily removed.

explanation:

text: The IUPAC nomenclature for the structure above is
explanation:

text: A hydrocarbon X with a molar mass of 26 consists of 92.3% carbon. What is its molecular formular?
explanation:
% of H2 = 100 - 92.3 = 7.7%mole = Carbon [92.3 / 12] = 7.7
Hydrogen [7.7 / 1] = 7.7
divide with the lowest:
Carbon - 7.1 / 7.1 = 1
Hydrogen  - 7.1 / 7.1 = 1
empirical formula = CH
(CH)n = 26(12 + 1)n = 26(13)n = 26n = 26/13 = 2
molecular formula = C\(_2\)H\(_2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A red precipitate of copper (I) carbide is formed when ammonium solution of copper (I) chloride is introduced into
explanation:

text: Polyvinyl chloride is used in the production of
explanation:
Polyvinyl chloride is used in the production of pipes. Polyvinyl chloride (PVC) is an odorless and solid plastic. It is most commonly white but can also be colorless or amber. It can also come in the form of white powder or pellets. PVC is made from vinyl chloride. The chemical formula for vinyl chloride is \(C_2H_3Cl\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Detergents are manufactured with straight hydrocarbon chains so as to make them
explanation:
The choice of straight hydrocarbon chains primarily serves the purpose of enhancing the biodegradability of the detergent, making it less harmful to the environment once it is washed away.Since unbranched (i.e., straight) chains are more prone to attack by bacteria, therefore in most of the detergents used these days, the branching is kept to be minimum so that the detergents become easily biodegradable.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
